title: Bjork upset with Commercial Appeal's choice of layout
text:
Bjork upset with Commercial Appeal's choice of layout Daniel Paulling, The Clarion-Ledger 5:19 p.m. CDT October 22, 2015 Ole Miss athletic director Ross Bjork wrote a letter to the editor expressing displeasure with the Commercial Appeal's layout following the Rebels' 37-24 loss to Memphis. (Photo: Kim Klement, Kim Klement-USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
. 
OXFORD -- Ole Miss athletic director Ross Bjork wrote a letter to the editor of The Commercial Appeal in Memphis to express his displeasure over the the newspaper's Sports section front last Sunday . 
The front page had a headline that read “SMASH HIT” with a photo of Ole Miss defensive tackle Robert Nkemdiche lying on the ground with Tigers celebrating around him. Nkemdiche suffered a concussion after being tackled on a rush attempt in the first half of last Saturday’s 37-24 loss to Memphis. 
“Using an image of a student-athlete knocked out with a concussion is no way to sell papers,” Bjork wrote. “Concussions and head injuries are extremely serious, and it’s unfortunate that you would use your platform to sensationalize them.” 
The injury forced Nkemdiche to miss the remainder of the game, leaving the Rebels without one of their best players on defense. The Tigers scored 17 consecutive points in the second quarter, taking a 24-14 lead into halftime that they wouldn’t lose. 
Commercial Appeal sports editor David Williams directed a request for comment about the layout to managing editor Mark Russell, who didn’t immediately provide comment. 
The Opelika-Auburn (Alabama) News used a photo of Rebels wide receiver Laquon Treadwell suffering a leg injury with a headline of “FINDING A WAY” on its sports front following the Rebels’ 35-31 loss to Auburn last season. 
Bjork wrote a letter to the editor following that incident as well.
